fourth.title: “UNCO Food Futures” for farmers/producers - Saved means earned
fourth.title_text1: It is a convenient tool for farmers and small producers: for example, milk can be bottled in several fat content variants and in different containers, cheese, powder and yogurt can be made... how to anticipate demand?
fourth.title_text2: Why add cost-increasing 'extra' processes like canning - if the product is already ordered and goes directly to the consumer?

fifth.title: The “UNCO Food Futures” solution for importers
fifth.title_text1: It is much more profitable to ship what have already been ordered.
fifth.title_text2: Your transport, hubs, and cross-docking start working more efficiently - because you are transporting already ordered 'fresh' which can be immediately shipped to the consumer. You get the money as soon as the buyer confirms the receipt of the corresponding quantity, assortment, and specification.
fifth.title_text3: Various forms of pre-financing are possible depending on your history and rating.

items.0: You put the specification, price, term, place and other terms of delivery on the trading platform “UNCO Exchange”
items.1: 'UNCO Exchange' does initial public offerings and facilitates B2B and B2C buyers.
items.2: Buyers select and pay for the lots you list
items.3: 'UNCO Food Futures' Smart Contracts are signed and released into free circulation
items.4: On the day of delivery, the goods are delivered to the respective 'UNCO Eco-Point' where the holder of the respective supply contract accepts acceptance of the goods and conformity with the specification
items.5: You receive payment (if other financing instruments are used, the relevant documents are signed, etc.)
items.6: Important: 'UNCO Food Futures' is a retail tool: all products must be packaged in 'retail' packaging, not exceeding 5 kg.

questions.1: Why should I sell the product as futures, where is my benefit?
questions.2: What permits do I need to be able to sell on your platform?
questions.3: What requirements do I have to meet to sell on your platform?
questions.4: When will I receive payment for the goods?
questions.5: How do you become a food futures seller?

answers.1: You sell products at the time of production planning, you know exactly what they will buy from you.You can offer several variants of the final product and you know exactly what they will buy. Example: if you produce milk, it could be: different pack sizes/different fat content/different shelf life.
answers.2: You need to have all the documentation required in your local market. Your products and production process must have the documentation required in your local market
answers.3: The minimum quantum of the product must be individually and hermitically packaged and have a storage temperature of at least zero degrees Celsius.
answers.4: Payment for the goods will be received at the moment of confirmation from the buyer, in accordance with the quantity, quality and specification.In case of disputes, a dispute is opened, where UNCO specialists are arbitrators. A solution mechanism is worked out jointly, up to inviting independent experts (see the terms of the contract).
answers.5: You need to submit an application.
